description: Students examine American families through the life cycle in relation to personal and
professional life, with the major emphasis on communication and commitment in
interpersonal relationships. Students study courtship, marriage, adjustment to
parenthood, and aging through engaging evidence-based research, case studies, and theoretical
frameworks. They examine stressors that affect families such as family violence,
divorce, grief and loss, and socioeconomic challenges.  This course takes an interdisciplinary
approach; students have opportunity for a broad range of individualized study. Offered
